attributes.action: Stop the halt in production of Ricicles due to the sugar tax bring Ricicles Back
attributes.additional_details: Ricicles are only produced in the UK and was a staple part of my up bringing, even when living in other countries. I understand obesity/ un-healthy living needs to be combated, however why should a manufacturer be forced to stop producing a popular product that is enjoyed by millions of healthy children throughout the UK.
attributes.background: Due to the governments introduction of the sugar tax, Kelloggs have decided to cease production of the Ricicles brand. I believe this should be upto the consumer whether or not they want to buy a high in sugar content cereal not the government.

rejection.details:
In any case, the "sugar tax" is a levy on soft drinks, not on other products containing sugar. You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/soft-drinks-industry-levy
